message.body: That Nina Simone song is like staring at a famous painting at the MET. arresting.
I think the albums by the same name. And it's all art. I almost sent you "I love your loving ways"
What you've given me in this album is more than anything I could ever send to shannon but I'm gonna try anyway

It's enough to know you like it :) have you heard of king creosote and Jon hopkins? The album is diamond mine. I know how you feel about electronic stuff but it's minimal and the songs are gorgeous separately but altogether... It's over.
Like a pebble in your shoe?
It's no Luke Skidmore guitar solo... It's a little moody. Let me know what you think if you get around to it. Hows tour?

Wonderful and awful. Lots of time to stare out a bus window and listen to Nina Simone. Good shows, bad shows. I do love the country rolling beneath me at 70 miles an hour for hours upon hours. And driving through the night while the band sleeps. Wonderful and awful.
Check out the eponymous McCartney album. (the one with every night)
Martha vs. whiskey + my bad memory for song titles
